info.title: openconfig-platform
info.description:
OpenConfig configuration data model

**Module:** `openconfig-platform`
**Paths:** 11

**📊 YANG Tree:** [View openconfig-platform structure](https://jeremycohoe.github.io/cisco-ios-xe-openapi-swagger/yang-trees/openconfig-platform.html)

get.description: Enclosing container for the components in the system.

put.description: Create or replace Enclosing container for the components in the system.

patch.description: Partially modify Enclosing container for the components in the system.

delete.description: Delete Enclosing container for the components in the system.

put.description: Create or replace Configuration data for each component

patch.description: Partially modify Configuration data for each component

delete.description: Delete Configuration data for each component

get.description: Operational state data for each component

put.description: Create or replace Operational state data for each component

patch.description: Partially modify Operational state data for each component

delete.description: Delete Operational state data for each component

get.description: List of components, keyed by component name. (collection)

post.description: Add a new entry to List of components, keyed by component name. (collection)

get.description: List of components, keyed by component name.

put.description: Create or replace List of components, keyed by component name.

patch.description: Partially modify List of components, keyed by component name.

delete.description: Delete List of components, keyed by component name.

put.description: Create or replace Configuration data for each component

patch.description: Partially modify Configuration data for each component

delete.description: Delete Configuration data for each component

get.description: Operational state data for each component

put.description: Create or replace Operational state data for each component

patch.description: Partially modify Operational state data for each component

delete.description: Delete Operational state data for each component

get.description: List of components, keyed by component name. (collection)

post.description: Add a new entry to List of components, keyed by component name. (collection)

get.description: List of components, keyed by component name.

put.description: Create or replace List of components, keyed by component name.

patch.description: Partially modify List of components, keyed by component name.

delete.description: Delete List of components, keyed by component name.

put.description: Create or replace Configuration data for each component

patch.description: Partially modify Configuration data for each component

delete.description: Delete Configuration data for each component

get.description: Operational state data for each component

put.description: Create or replace Operational state data for each component

patch.description: Partially modify Operational state data for each component

delete.description: Delete Operational state data for each component

name.description: References the component name

type.description: Type of component as identified by the system

id.description:
Unique identifier assigned by the system for the
        component

location.description:
System-supplied description of the location of the
        component within the system. This could be a bay position,
        slot number, socket location, etc. For component types that
        have an explicit slot-id attribute, such as linecards, the
        system should populate the more specific slot-id.

mfg-name.description:
System-supplied identifier for the manufacturer of the
        component.  This data is particularly useful when a
        component manufacturer is different than the overall
        device vendor.

mfg-date.description:
System-supplied representation of the component's
        manufacturing date.

hardware-version.description:
For hardware components, this is the hardware revision of
        the component.

firmware-version.description:
For hardware components, this is the version of associated
        firmware that is running on the component, if applicable.

software-version.description:
For software components such as operating system or other
        software module, this is the version of the currently
        running software.

serial-no.description: System-assigned serial number of the component.

part-no.description:
System-assigned part number for the component.  This should
        be present in particular if the component is also an FRU
        (field replaceable unit)

removable.description:
If true, this component is removable or is a field
        replaceable unit

oper-status.description:
If applicable, this reports the current operational status
        of the component.

empty.description:
The empty leaf may be used by the device to indicate that a
        component position exists but is not populated.  Using this
        flag, it is possible for the management system to learn how
        many positions are available (e.g., occupied vs. empty
        linecard slots in a chassis).

parent.description:
Reference to the name of the parent component.  Note that
        this reference must be kept synchronized with the
        corresponding subcomponent reference from the parent
        component.

instant.description: The instantaneous value of the statistic.

avg.description:
The arithmetic mean value of the statistic over the
        sampling period.

min.description:
The minimum value of the statistic over the sampling
        period

max.description:
The maximum value of the statistic over the sampling
        period

alarm-status.description:
A value of true indicates the alarm has been raised or
        asserted.  The value should be false when the alarm is
        cleared.

alarm-threshold.description: The threshold value that was crossed for this alarm.

alarm-severity.description: The severity of the current alarm.

instant.description: The instantaneous value of the statistic.

avg.description:
The arithmetic mean value of the statistic over the
        sampling period.

min.description:
The minimum value of the statistic over the sampling
        period

max.description:
The maximum value of the statistic over the sampling
        period

alarm-status.description:
A value of true indicates the alarm has been raised or
        asserted.  The value should be false when the alarm is
        cleared.

alarm-threshold.description: The threshold value that was crossed for this alarm.

alarm-severity.description: The severity of the current alarm.

temperature.description:
Temperature in degrees Celsius of the component. Values include
        the instantaneous, average, minimum, and maximum statistics. If
        avg/min/max statistics are not supported, the target is expected
        to just supply the instant value

available.description:
The available memory physically installed, or logically
          allocated to the component.

utilized.description:
The memory currently in use by processes running on
          the component, not considering reserved memory that is
          not available for use.

available.description:
The available memory physically installed, or logically
          allocated to the component.

utilized.description:
The memory currently in use by processes running on
          the component, not considering reserved memory that is
          not available for use.

memory.description:
For components that have associated memory, these values
        report information about available and utilized memory.

allocated-power.description: Power allocated by the system for the component.

used-power.description: Actual power used by the component.

value.description:
Property values can take on a variety of types.  Signed and
        unsigned integer types may be provided in smaller sizes,
        e.g., int8, uint16, etc.

configurable.description: Indication whether the property is user-configurable

name.description: Reference to the property name.

value.description:
Property values can take on a variety of types.  Signed and
        unsigned integer types may be provided in smaller sizes,
        e.g., int8, uint16, etc.

configurable.description: Indication whether the property is user-configurable

name.description:
System-supplied name of the property -- this is typically
        non-configurable

value.description:
Property values can take on a variety of types.  Signed and
        unsigned integer types may be provided in smaller sizes,
        e.g., int8, uint16, etc.

        e.g., int8, uint16, etc.

name.description:
Device name for the component -- this may not be a
        configurable parameter on many implementations.  Where
        component preconfiguration is supported, for example,
        the component name may be configurable.

        configurable parameter on many implementations.  Where
        component preconfiguration is supported, for example,
        the component name may be configurable.

The minimum value of the statistic over the sampling
        period

max.description:
The maximum value of the statistic over the sampling
        period

alarm-status.description:
A value of true indicates the alarm has been raised or
        asserted.  The value should be false when the alarm is
        cleared.

alarm-threshold.description: The threshold value that was crossed for this alarm.

alarm-severity.description: The severity of the current alarm.

instant.description: The instantaneous value of the statistic.

avg.description:
The arithmetic mean value of the statistic over the
        sampling period.

The minimum value of the statistic over the sampling
        period

max.description:
The maximum value of the statistic over the sampling
        period

alarm-status.description:
A value of true indicates the alarm has been raised or
        asserted.  The value should be false when the alarm is
        cleared.

alarm-threshold.description: The threshold value that was crossed for this alarm.

alarm-severity.description: The severity of the current alarm.

temperature.description:
Temperature in degrees Celsius of the component. Values include
        the instantaneous, average, minimum, and maximum statistics. If
        avg/min/max statistics are not supported, the target is expected
        to just supply the instant value

available.description:
The available memory physically installed, or logically
          allocated to the component.

utilized.description:
The memory currently in use by processes running on
          the component, not considering reserved memory that is
          not available for use.

utilized.description:
The memory currently in use by processes running on
          the component, not considering reserved memory that is
          not available for use.

memory.description:
For components that have associated memory, these values
        report information about available and utilized memory.

allocated-power.description: Power allocated by the system for the component.

used-power.description: Actual power used by the component.

value.description:
Property values can take on a variety of types.  Signed and
        unsigned integer types may be provided in smaller sizes,
        e.g., int8, uint16, etc.

configurable.description: Indication whether the property is user-configurable

Operational state data for transceiver components

Operational state data for fan components

Operational state data for storage components
Operational state data for cpu components
Operational state data for chip components

integrated-circuit.description: Data for chip components, such as ASIC, NPUs, etc.

state.description: Operational state data for backplane components

name.description:
Device name for the component -- this may not be a
        configurable parameter on many implementations.  Where
        component preconfiguration is supported, for example,
        the component name may be configurable.

Device name for the component -- this may not be a
        configurable parameter on many implementations.  Where
        component preconfiguration is supported, for example,
        the component name may be configurable.

type.description: Type of component as identified by the system

id.description:
Unique identifier assigned by the system for the
        component

location.description:
System-supplied description of the location of the
        component within the system. This could be a bay position,
        slot number, socket location, etc. For component types that
        have an explicit slot-id attribute, such as linecards, the
        system should populate the more specific slot-id.

mfg-name.description:
System-supplied identifier for the manufacturer of the
        component.  This data is particularly useful when a
        component manufacturer is different than the overall
        device vendor.

mfg-date.description:
System-supplied representation of the component's
        manufacturing date.

hardware-version.description:
For hardware components, this is the hardware revision of
        the component.

firmware-version.description:
For hardware components, this is the version of associated
        firmware that is running on the component, if applicable.

software-version.description:
For software components such as operating system or other
        software module, this is the version of the currently
        running software.

serial-no.description: System-assigned serial number of the component.

part-no.description:
System-assigned part number for the component.  This should
        be present in particular if the component is also an FRU
        (field replaceable unit)

removable.description:
If true, this component is removable or is a field
        replaceable unit

oper-status.description:
If applicable, this reports the current operational status
        of the component.

empty.description:
The empty leaf may be used by the device to indicate that a
        component position exists but is not populated.  Using this
        flag, it is possible for the management system to learn how
        many positions are available (e.g., occupied vs. empty
        linecard slots in a chassis).

parent.description:
Reference to the name of the parent component.  Note that
        this reference must be kept synchronized with the
        corresponding subcomponent reference from the parent
        component.

instant.description: The instantaneous value of the statistic.

avg.description:
The arithmetic mean value of the statistic over the
        sampling period.

min.description:
The minimum value of the statistic over the sampling
        period

max.description:
The maximum value of the statistic over the sampling
        period

A value of true indicates the alarm has been raised or
        asserted.  The value should be false when the alarm is
        cleared.

alarm-threshold.description: The threshold value that was crossed for this alarm.

alarm-severity.description: The severity of the current alarm.
